level.text: 102.1 The Program shall conduct any investigation that is necessary to make an ID of eligibility for benefits under this chapter.

The Program shall investigate the claim throughout the life of the claim to confirm that a claimant or employee is still entitled to benefits under the Act, including, when necessary, to make an eligibility determination (ED).

Claimants and employees are required to cooperate with all aspects of the Program’s investigation, including participating in “alive and well checks,” attending physical examinations, and providing documentation of all medical services, earnings information, and dependent and marital status.

Source: Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 28 DCR 2307 (May 22, 1981); as amended by a Notice of Emergency and Proposed Rulemaking published at 57 DCR 9540 (October 8, 2010)[EXPIRED]; as amended by a Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 57 DCR 12224 (December 24, 2010); repealed and replaced by Final Rulemaking published at 59 DCR 8766, 8767 (July 27, 2012).
